availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jonathan B. Nichols (Boyle County, Kentucky, county court clerk)

body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky, court clerk. Danville, Kentucky, native. Son of Jonathan Nichols and Matilda Ball Nichols. Married to Agnes Crutchfield Nichols. Father of William S. Nichols, Richard C. Nichols, and Reed S. Nichols. County court clerk in Boyle County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Boyle County in 1850. County court clerk in Boyle County, Kentucky, in 1860. Household owned one enslaved person in Boyle County in 1860. County court clerk in Boyle County in 1862. County court clerk in Boyle County in 1865.
